comments.body: 5. Add a glowing flower that can only grow at night. It will glow just like how glow squid glow. The flower will be destroyed or become indestructible during the daytime.

Since both Silverfish and The Creaking have a special connection to a specific block, silverfish should spawn in the new biome.

There could also be "silverfish rocks" generating in the biome. That is clusters of stone and infested stone.

On top of that, silverfish are gray!

1. Its texture should look more like the willow tree.

4. Yes, more birds please. Active at day, silent at night. Maybe tameable with small gifting feature.

5. Any extra vegetation would be a great addition to a pale "garden". Decorative flowers, white/grey pumpkins, etc.

Also a small structure of graveyard ruins with potential loot.
Smart idea

Actually I think Jungles have some of the easiest sources of wood, a treetop where no mobs spawn and is perfectly safe to live on, has three unique mobs, and is the only source of scaffolding and cocoa beans. I love the biome, but it doesn't need any more buffs than it already has.

If this were added, then I think they would have to add new variants to the phantom, like an icy one and a fiery one that only spawns in that dimension, or maybe call it the dream dimension and add other night and dream-related mobs.

It's so creepy to fight phantoms during nights illuminated by lightnings. A phantom boss could be found in large areas without mobs.
It would create storms with wind that slows down the player. Due to the dust raised by the wind and the rain the player would not be able to see around him and the boss would be illuminated by random lightnings. The boss could attack with very loud screams and cause negative effects by looking at the player with its eyes for a few seconds. When it reaches a low standard of living, it would call some normal phantoms to help it, they will be able to see even in the dust.
The Phantom boss would be a giant phantom with more details on the wings, including veins as green as its eyes. Being injured its wings would tear and spots of green blood would appear on its body.
Defeating it would drop many levels of experience, phantom membrane and a pupil of its eyes, which can be used to create a device to see very far away, even at night and underwater. A kind of telescope.
By the way, lightning does a lot of damage to wooden builds or otherwise flammable builds. Good idea, though.
Nice i like it

Hail breaking glass could be an interesting addition, especially if they added seasons to temperate biomes.

I've always wanted to see harsh blizzards and sandstorms. Both types of storms could have a slowness effect on the player and restrict vision like bedrock does. Sandstorms could introduce tumbleweeds flying across the environment and the sand could even cause minor damage to the player if not equipped with a full set of armor

I really like this idea. It would be a cool way to show the boundaries between the life in the Nether and the dead parts of it. After all, the deadest part of the Nether is the Ghasts, Wither Skeletons, and the Nether Wastes. A Decayed Depths biome would be a nice addition.

Neon Biome and Its Inhabitants

I'm guessing this is for bedrock seeing that you're saying coordinates can be enabled in settings, but for anyone wondering, this is available for java if you press f3 + g.

I’d love to see this in all Bedrock versions as a lot of automated machines will break of not chunk aligned properly, and all ways of currently chunk aligning (or even seeing where chunks are) are long and tedious (playing with render distance with fancy leaves settings, using glitches, going to the corner of a map and placing blocks till you reach the end, or uploading ur seed into a chunk finder website and getting coordinates to the end of a chunk) compared to pressing a button on a key board for the Java version. As a long time Bedrock player (since 2012) I would love to see an option right there in the settings to show chunk borders in Bedrock

This would be a great thing I say. If u could please make it like Java or different but just have it so bedrock player can see the chunks and them be out lined. You could make it a setting or put it in the controls so we can pick what makes it turn on. Also I like bedrocks stuff but on Java they can hit a key and a lot of info like there seed, coordinates, what way they are facing like north and south and it is in the top left corner. I know there more but I don’t know it all. Some thing like that in bedrock would be nice to have. https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360021284311-Dead-Sea-biome- 

Salt and a salty biome have already been suggested, although the biome post is very vague.

I like the idea of ​​having a desert variation, so I suggest doing something inspired by the Salar of Uyuni.

The Salar of Uyuni, the largest salt desert in the world, is one of the great natural wonders of Bolivia. About 3500 meters of altitude, it is an important one, being a source of minerals like lithium, magnesium, potassium and sodium, a lot of sodium.

Isla del Pescado, is an elevation over the Salar de Uyuni. One of its main characteristics is the feet of giant cacti, which can reach more than 10 meters in height.

This style of slag desert could come as a biome on Mountain Update, being found in the Andes, a large mountain range.

The addition of a salt desert could bring many new possibilities for exploration, in addition to adding more variety to the game.
